title: 📽 "Don’t settle for average. Bring your best to the moment." - Angela Bassett
content:
(thanks Tom!): Write a function that can do the 4 basic operations (add, subtract, multiply and divide) on two fractions. Return the most simplified form of the result. You can assume a non-zero denominator in the input, and don’t use any built-in implementations in your language of choice, if you can!

Example:

> fractionMath("3/4", "add", "3/4")
> "3/2"

> fractionMath("1/8", "multiply", "2/2")
> "1/8"
